More Notes: Assumes adaptation maintains production stop probability at 1/100 yr under future scenarios; Value is placeholder indicating *some* cost, but unquantified on this page.
Assumes drinking water companies increase consumer prices to cover adaptation costs due to inelastic demand; Value is placeholder indicating *some* cost, but unquantified on this page.

Shadow price derived from agricultural impact model outcomes as a regression between crop evapotranspiration and crop yield minus additional irrigation costs; Value is placeholder indicating *some* benefit, but unquantified on this page.

Water shortages are monetized for flushing and water level management using a shadow price of water. Implicit assumption that the value of water for nature and infrastructure is greater or equal to the marginal value for agriculture; Value is placeholder indicating *some* benefit, but unquantified on this page.
Discount rate used for public infrastructure investments with substantial fixed costs (high end).

A policy action is positively evaluated from a societal welfare perspective if the avoided drought risk is greater than or equal to costs (monetized and non-monetized effects included). 1 if it is positively evaluated, 0 if not.
